com.gej.object.types

Class DirectionedGObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gej.object.GObject
      • com.gej.object.types.DirectionedGObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Updateable

    public class DirectionedGObject
extends GObject
    A customized object to move along directions. Useful if the object moves in directions.
    Author:
    Sri Harsha Chilakapati

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DirectionedGObject()
      Constructs an object which is invisible
      DirectionedGObject(Animation anim)
      Constructs an object with an animation object.

      Constructs an object with an animation at a position x,y
      DirectionedGObject(float x, float y)
      Constructs an invisible object at a position x,y
      DirectionedGObject(java.awt.Image img)
      Constructs an object with an image object.
      DirectionedGObject(java.awt.Image img, float x, float y)
      public float getDirection(){ return direction; } Constructs an object with an image at a position x,y

        dir - The new direction

      • setDirection

        public void setDirection(Direction dir)
        Sets the direction of this object. Use this method only to make movement in only one direction. If the direction is horizontal, the vertical direction is none. Else the horizontal direction is none.
        Parameters:
        dir - The new direction

      • getVerticalDirection

        public Direction getVerticalDirection()
        Returns the vertical direction of this object
        Returns:
        the vertical direction of this object

        Returns:
        the horizontal direction of this object

      • updateVelocities

        public void updateVelocities()
        Updates the velocities of this object based on the vertical and horizontal directions.

      • setVelocity

        public void setVelocity(float vel)
        Sets the velocity of this object. The velocity must be always positive. If negative velocities are used, then the direction will be reversed.
        Parameters:
        vel - The new velocity of this object.

      • getVelocity

        public float getVelocity()
        Gets you the current velocity of this object
        Returns:
        the current velocity of this object
